verses.verse: To the chief Musician, <S%H5329><s%> to <S%H5921><s%> Jeduthun, <S%H3038><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> Truly <S%H389><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> waiteth <S%H1747><s%> upon <S%H413><s%> God: <S%H430><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> him cometh my salvation. <S%H3444><s%>
He <S%H1931><s%> only <S%H389><s%> is my rock <S%H6697><s%> and my salvation; <S%H3444><s%> he is my defense; <S%H4869><s%> I shall not <S%H3808><s%> be greatly <S%H7227><s%> moved. <S%H4131><s%>

How long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H575><s%> will ye imagine mischief <S%H2050><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> a man? <S%H376><s%> ye shall be slain <S%H7523><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> of you: as a bowing <S%H5186><s%> wall <S%H7023><s%> shall ye be, and as a tottering <S%H1760><s%> fence. <S%H1447><s%>

They only <S%H389><s%> consult <S%H3289><s%> to cast him down <S%H5080><s%> from his excellency: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7613><s%> they delight <S%H7521><s%> in lies: <S%H3577><s%> they bless <S%H1288><s%> with their mouth, <S%H6310><s%> but they curse <S%H7043><s%> inwardly. <S%H7130><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
My soul, <S%H5315><s%> wait <S%H1826><s%> thou only <S%H389><s%> upon God; <S%H430><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> my expectation <S%H8615><s%> is from <S%H4480><s%> him.
He <S%H1931><s%> only <S%H389><s%> is my rock <S%H6697><s%> and my salvation: <S%H3444><s%> he is my defense; <S%H4869><s%> I shall not <S%H3808><s%> be moved. <S%H4131><s%>
In <S%H5921><s%> God <S%H430><s%> is my salvation <S%H3468><s%> and my glory: <S%H3519><s%> the rock <S%H6697><s%> of my strength, <S%H5797><s%> and my refuge, <S%H4268><s%> is in God. <S%H430><s%>

Trust <S%H982><s%> in him at all <S%H3605><s%> times; <S%H6256><s%> ye people, <S%H5971><s%> pour out <S%H8210><s%> your heart <S%H3824><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him: God <S%H430><s%> is a refuge <S%H4268><s%> for us. Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

Surely <S%H389><s%> men of low degree <S%H1121><s%> <S%H120><s%> are vanity, <S%H1892><s%> and men of high degree <S%H1121><s%> <S%H376><s%> are a lie: <S%H3577><s%> to be laid <S%H5927><s%> in the balance, <S%H3976><s%> they <S%H1992><s%> are altogether <S%H3162><s%> lighter than vanity. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1892><s%>

Trust <S%H982><s%> not <S%H408><s%> in oppression, <S%H6233><s%> and become not vain <S%H1891><s%> <S%H408><s%> in robbery: <S%H1498><s%> if <S%H3588><s%> riches <S%H2428><s%> increase, <S%H5107><s%> set <S%H7896><s%> not <S%H408><s%> your heart <S%H3820><s%> upon them.

God <S%H430><s%> hath spoken <S%H1696><s%> once; <S%H259><s%> twice <S%H8147><s%> have I heard <S%H8085><s%> this; <S%H2098><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> power <S%H5797><s%> belongeth unto God. <S%H430><s%>
Also unto thee, O Lord, <S%H136><s%> belongeth mercy: <S%H2617><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> thou <S%H859><s%> renderest <S%H7999><s%> to every man <S%H376><s%> according to his work. <S%H4639><s%>
